column2: ALASKA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Turn off the ignition.
column6: Slow down.
column8: Yield.

column2: 2. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column6: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column10: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.

column2: 3. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over your left shoulder.
column6: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column8: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 4. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the right side mirror.
column6: look into the rearview mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column10: look into the left side mirror.

column2: 5. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians may turn right.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: Drivers should walk more and drive less.

column2: 6. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 7. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 8. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to reduce your speed.

column2: 9. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.
column6: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.

column2: 10. When parallel parking between two cars, you should first:
column4: back slowly.
column6: pull up even with the front car.
column8: turn your wheels to the right.
column10: turn your wheels to the left.

column2: 11. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 12. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 13. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 14. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Get enough sleep.

column2: 15. Bicyclists must:
column4: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 16. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Winding road ahead.

column2: 18. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column6: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your headlights only.

column2: 19. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 20. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Return gestures and shouts.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Make eye contact.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
